item.title: Fatherhood After 40? It's Becoming A Lot More Common
item.description: August 31, 2017 - The average age for fathers of newborns in the U.S. has risen from 27.4 years back in 1972 to 30.9 years now. And if the baby's dad has a college degree, he's likely to be even older.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 31, 2017 - The average age for fathers of newborns in the U.S. has risen from 27.4 years back in 1972 to 30.9 years now. And if the baby's dad has a college degree, he's likely to be even older. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/08/31/547320586/fatherhood-after-forty-its-now-a-lot-more-common-study-finds

item.title: Live In Hawaii, And Odds Are You'll Need Fewer Prescription Meds
item.description: August 31, 2017 - People who live in the Aloha State are less likely to use opioid painkillers or be prescribed antibiotics than are mainland dwellers. Healthy lifestyles have a lot to do with that.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 31, 2017 - People who live in the Aloha State are less likely to use opioid painkillers or be prescribed antibiotics than are mainland dwellers. Healthy lifestyles have a lot to do with that. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/08/31/547317533/ornstein-it-s-better-in-hawaii

item.title: In Houston, Most Hospitals 'Up And Fully Functional'
item.description: August 30, 2017 - In the past few days, Southeast Texas' catastrophic medical operations center has faced challenges like it has never seen before in keeping the health care system functioning.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 30, 2017 - In the past few days, Southeast Texas' catastrophic medical operations center has faced challenges like it has never seen before in keeping the health care system functioning. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/08/30/547327581/in-houston-most-hospitals-up-and-fully-functional

item.title: Whatever Happened To ... Those Farmers Who Needed Shoes?
item.description: August 30, 2017 - It was a mystery: How did farmers in Uganda contract a nightmare illness? A researcher found the answer. What's the best way to help them?
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 30, 2017 - It was a mystery: How did farmers in Uganda contract a nightmare illness? A researcher found the answer. What's the best way to help them? http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/08/30/547051705/whatever-happened-to-those-farmers-who-needed-shoes

item.title: Why The Toxin Trouble With Tiny Turtles Continues
item.description: August 30, 2017 - The government is warning people not to handle tiny turtles because of the risk of contracting salmonella. The problem is, it has been warning us for 40 years and we're still getting sick.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 30, 2017 - The government is warning people not to handle tiny turtles because of the risk of contracting salmonella. The problem is, it has been warning us for 40 years and we're still getting sick. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/08/30/547305528/why-the-toxin-trouble-with-tiny-turtles-continues

item.title: FDA Approves First Gene Therapy For Leukemia
item.description: August 30, 2017 - The process modifies patients' immune cells to attack their own cancer cells. It was approved to treat acute lymphoblastic leukemia in children and young adults — the most common childhood cancer.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 30, 2017 - The process modifies patients' immune cells to attack their own cancer cells. It was approved to treat acute lymphoblastic leukemia in children and young adults — the most common childhood cancer. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/08/30/547293551/fda-approves-first-gene-therapy-treatment-for-cancer

item.title: 'This Is Surreal': Houston Dialysis Center Struggles To Treat Patients
item.description: August 30, 2017 - People with kidney failure typically need dialysis every other day to stay healthy. Delays in treatment can quickly become life-threatening.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 30, 2017 - People with kidney failure typically need dialysis every other day to stay healthy. Delays in treatment can quickly become life-threatening. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/08/30/547004371/this-is-surreal-houston-dialysis-center-struggles-to-treat-patients

item.title: 5 Controversial Ideas For Shoring Up Health Insurance Markets
item.description: August 30, 2017 - Lawmakers looking to stabilize the health insurance exchanges may consider a number of proposals — including pushing young adults off a parent's plan or letting people buy into Medicare and Medicaid.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 30, 2017 - Lawmakers looking to stabilize the health insurance exchanges may consider a number of proposals — including pushing young adults off a parent's plan or letting people buy into Medicare and Medicaid. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/08/30/546793927/5-controversial-ideas-for-shoring-up-health-insurance-markets

item.title: Health Issues Stack Up In Houston As Harvey Evacuees Seek Shelter
item.description: August 29, 2017 - With thousands of people displaced, health workers are trying to address the immediate medical needs of evacuees as well as mental health issues made worse by the disaster.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 29, 2017 - With thousands of people displaced, health workers are trying to address the immediate medical needs of evacuees as well as mental health issues made worse by the disaster. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/08/29/547027763/health-issues-stack-up-in-houston-as-harvey-evacuees-seek-shelter

item.title: Epic Floods Challenge Aid Workers On Opposite Sides Of The World
item.description: August 29, 2017 - Two weeks before Hurricane Harvey struck, monsoon rains swamped Bangladesh, India and Nepal. Aid groups are struggling to deal with both disasters.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 29, 2017 - Two weeks before Hurricane Harvey struck, monsoon rains swamped Bangladesh, India and Nepal. Aid groups are struggling to deal with both disasters. http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/08/29/547002884/epic-floods-not-just-in-texas-are-a-challenge-for-aid-groups

item.title: For Navajos, Desert 'Tea' Fosters Kinship With Heritage And Nature
item.description: August 29, 2017 - Some Navajo are trying to bring back their traditional food culture, including drinking Navajo "tea." It's brewed with a plant called greenthread that thrives in the mid-summer heat of the Southwest.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 29, 2017 - Some Navajo are trying to bring back their traditional food culture, including drinking Navajo "tea." It's brewed with a plant called greenthread that thrives in the mid-summer heat of the Southwest. http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/08/29/546817827/for-navajos-desert-tea-fosters-kinship-with-heritage-and-nature

item.title: Syringe Exchange Program Aims To Slow Hepatitis C Infections In Alaska
item.description: August 29, 2017 - As the nation's opioid abuse problem soars, so do health problems associated with drug use like hepatitis C, which is placing a major burden on Alaska's Medicaid program.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 29, 2017 - As the nation's opioid abuse problem soars, so do health problems associated with drug use like hepatitis C, which is placing a major burden on Alaska's Medicaid program. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/08/29/547054395/syringe-exchange-program-aims-to-slow-hepatitis-c-infections-in-alaska

item.title: How Moldy Hay And Sick Cows Led To A Lifesaving Drug
item.description: August 29, 2017 - The blood thinner warfarin, which prevents blood clots, owes its existence to some cows who got very sick after eating spoiled hay — and to a chemist who spent years trying to figure out why.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 29, 2017 - The blood thinner warfarin, which prevents blood clots, owes its existence to some cows who got very sick after eating spoiled hay — and to a chemist who spent years trying to figure out why. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/08/29/531749974/how-moldy-hay-and-sick-cows-led-to-a-life-saving-drug

item.title: Holistic Therapy Programs May Help Pain Sufferers Ditch Opioids
item.description: August 29, 2017 - Learning strategies to deal with chronic pain can be an effective way to stay off addictive medicines, says the head of the Mayo Clinic's pain rehab center. But insurance doesn't always cover it.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 29, 2017 - Learning strategies to deal with chronic pain can be an effective way to stay off addictive medicines, says the head of the Mayo Clinic's pain rehab center. But insurance doesn't always cover it. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/08/29/546145817/holistic-therapy-programs-may-help-pain-sufferers-ditch-opioids

item.title: Stay Safe And Get A Tetanus Shot, Texas Health Officials Urge
item.description: August 28, 2017 - Texas public health officials are looking ahead to meeting health needs in the days and weeks ahead, including getting prescriptions to people displaced to shelters.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 28, 2017 - Texas public health officials are looking ahead to meeting health needs in the days and weeks ahead, including getting prescriptions to people displaced to shelters. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/08/28/546781492/stay-safe-and-get-a-tetanus-shot-texas-health-officials-urge
